Trigger.Name: 2 Sigma "/e _test sigma"
Trigger.Description: 1 cross 2 triangle 3 chain1 4 attack1 5 attack2 6 ignore1 7 ignore2 8 chain2

Trigger.Name: 3 Omega "/e _test omega" (will go through both patterns, takes about 50 seconds to complete!)
Trigger.Description:
marks (first set) 1 - ignore2 2 - chain1 3 - attack1 4 - attack2 5 - triangle 6 - plus 7 - ignore1 8 - chain2
marks (second set) 1 - attack2 2 - chain1 3 - triangle 4 - ignore1 5 - ignore2 6 - attack1 7 - chain2 8 - plus

Trigger.Name: Mark 3 - Far Baits and Near Baits

Action.LogMessageText: TOP Dynamis Automarker Far Bait 1: ${lvar:TOPdynamisAMparty[1]}, Far Bait 2: ${lvar:TOPdynamisAMparty[2]}, Near Bait 1: ${lvar:TOPdynamisAMparty[4]}, Near Bait 2: ${lvar:TOPdynamisAMparty[1]}

Trigger.Name: ##INSTRUCTIONS - see description tab
Trigger.Description:
If you wish to customize the priority, copy the folder labeled "copy to local" to your local triggers. Make sure the local copy is enabled, and the remote copy of the folder is disabled. If you are happy with the default prio, you can enable it in remote without copying it.
Telesto is *required* for these triggers, to build the party list and to send the mark commands to the game. You can use "/e _reset" to manually trigger telesto to rebuild the party list. https://github.com/paissaheavyindustries/Telesto
To customize priority, change the order that party members are pushed to the party list in the Priority trigger in your local folder. The default priority assumes the in game party list is in this order: DTTHHDDD, and prioritizes healers getting mechanics/far baits and tanks getting near baits.
In Delta, only the near/distant world players are marked. Players with near and distant world will be marked with cross/plus (distant) and triangle (near). Since these are randomly assigned, all players must be able to do these. Players close to the top of the list will have higher priority to be assigned the mechanic positions in Sigma and Omega (fist & monitor baits and tethers). The two players at the top of the list will never get near baits, and the two players at the end of the list will never get far baits. Near bait assignments are done with chain 2 going on the 2nd to last person, and chain 1 going on the last person in the list, so it's best to place main tank at the bottom of the list to ensure that they will not get deleted by an auto after Sigma due to magic vuln. If you only want auto markers for specific trios, disable the triggers labeled with the one you do not want. However, DO NOT disable the Dynamis trigger, as this is required for both the sigma and omega trios to mark properly.
Suggested cheatsheet images: Sigma - attack1 & 2 and ignore 1 always go to the female, everyone else go across from the female. All south players follow the rotating line to get to their spot (if it's CW, near baits on west side, if it's CCW, east side) https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1070072195394568283/1074408080609116381/image.png https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1070072195394568283/1074408081074700428/image.png Omega - treat the monitor side and beetle as north, and you can resolve both of these in the same manner, just be careful to not get clipped by the monitor. https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/1074847295012610059/1075330351242694696/image.png https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/1074847295012610059/1075330351553060895/image.png
Test triggers are included to verify base functionality. To test, you can go into an instance of with a party of 8. Use the "/e _reset" command to force telesto to update the party list. Then, use one of the following commands in game: /e _test delta /e _test sigma /e _test omega Please note that the omega test trigger will simulate both the monitor and the tether variation of the mechanic, so it will take about 50 seconds to complete. It also will take about 8 seconds to do the first marks, so be patient.
